properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 4 at 3:33AM CST until February 5 at 12:00AM CST by NWS St Louis MO
properties.description:
* WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation of
snow and light freezing rain expected. Total snow accumulations
of up to one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds
gusting as high as 30 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy
snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches
possible.

* WHERE...Portions of central, east central and northeast
Missouri and southwest and west central Illinois.

* WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from noon today to
midnight CST tonight. For the Winter Storm Watch, from
Wednesday morning through late Wednesday night.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the commute this evening and also the
morning and evening commutes on Wednesday.
properties.instruction:
A Winter Weather Advisory is issued for a variety of winter
weather conditions, such as snow, blowing snow, sleet, or
freezing drizzle and rain. It only takes a small amount of wintry
precipitation to make roads, bridges, sidewalks, and parking lots
icy and dangerous. It is often difficult to tell when ice begins
to form, so do not be caught off guard.

A Winter Storm Watch is advanced notice that the potential for
severe winter weather exists in the Watch area, but it does not
mean it is a certainty. Those in the Watch area should begin
preparing in case the storm does materialize. If you have travel
planned, you may want to adjust your travel time to avoid the
storm. Also, you should use this advanced notice to make certain
your vehicle is winterized. Make preparations at home by stocking
emergency supplies, such as food, medicine, and extra heating
fuel, just in case the storm makes travel impossible. This is
especially important for those living in rural areas.

In Illinois, the latest road conditions can be obtained on the
Internet at www.gettingaroundillinois.com. In Missouri, the
latest road conditions can be obtained on the Internet at
traveler.modot.org/map/ or by calling 1-888-275-6636.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO MIDNIGHT CST TONIGHT... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT
